articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: GERMAN winger Nicolas Kuhn tonight confirmed his £3million move to Celtic when he signed a five-and-a-half year deal with the champions. The Hoops had been tracking Rapid Vienna’s left-footed touchline ace who can play on either flank since the start of the season and the club were delighted to get the deal over the line. [...]
articles.title: CONFIRMED: KUHN SIGNS FIVE-AND-A-HALF YEAR DEAL

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: With 18 months left on his Celtic contract, Adam Montgomery (21) has joined Motherwell on loan until the end of the season.  A loan at Fleetwood Town for the first half of the season was unproductive for the left back, who, as an 18-year-old, manned the defensive fort during Ange Postecoglou’s early weeks in charge [...]
articles.title: Callum, Adam and Arrivederci Jose

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: DENIS CONNAGHAN answered a goalkeeping SOS from Jock Stein – only hours after one of the most infamous results in Celtic’s history. The legendary boss was raging after the Hoops’ 4-1 flop against Partick Thistle in the remarkable League Cup Final flop at Hampden on the Saturday afternoon of October 23 1971. Evan Williams unfairly [...]
articles.title: DENIS CONNAGHAN: THE KEEPER WHO ANSWERED BIG JOCK’S SOS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS will not welcome any distractions as he focuses on strengthening his Celtic squad in this transfer window. The Hoops are poised to unveil latest recruit Nicolas Kuhn today with two more additions possibly in the wings before the market place shuts down in just over a fortnight. One position Rodgers has already stated [...]
articles.title: FORGET KELLEHER AND CO – FOR NOW

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC defender Adam Montgomery has sealed his short-term loan move to Motherwell, as CQN reported yesterday. And the 21-year-old left-back, who already has experience of three previous temporary switches at Aberdeen, St Johnstone and Fleetwood Town, is eager to get back into the thick of the action. Montgomery, who made only six appearances for the [...]
articles.title: MONTY ‘EXCITED’, ARAUJO ‘CALM’

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BULGARIAN international forward Aleksandar Tonev was yet another underwhelming signing during Ronny Deial’s two-year stint. The versatile midfielder/winger arrived in August 2014 on a year-long loan from Aston Villa. Tonev didn’t get off the most encouraging starts during his new career in Glasgow. Boss Deila needed cover for James Forrest, suffering a succession of injuries, [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…ALEKSANDAR TONEV?

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Getting your top targets in is usually difficult to do in the middle of a transfer window, even more so in January.  The selling club is incentivised to make you wait until the last few days, while they work on attracting a competitive bid.  Whatever your opening bid is, it’s not enough.  Why would it [...]
articles.title: Anatomy of transfer negotiations

articles.author: CQN Magazine

So far, Japan’s Reo Hatate and Daizen Maeda and Australia’s Marco Tilio have been left frustrated as they have been snubbed for their nations’ first game [...]

articles.description: NICOLAS KUHN is poised for a quickfire Celtic debut against Buckie Thistle in the Scottish Cup at Parkhead on Sunday afternoon. articles.title: £3m KUHN’S QUICKFIRE DEBUT

articles.description: CELTIC defender Adam Montgomery is heading for his FOURTH loan deal in three years. Montgomery has already had spells at Aberdeen and St Johnstone in his efforts to gain much-needed game-time. Brendan [...]

Mulumbu, after making [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…YOUSSOUF MULUMBU?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BOSS Graeme Stewart could be BANNED from Buckie Thistle’s Scottish Cup-tie against Celtic at Parkhead a week today. The gaffer could miss the biggest game in the club’s history after seeing red in his side’s 3-2 Highland League win over Huntly yesterday. Stewart was banished by referee Harry Bruce after a 55th-minute flashpoint with opposition midfielder [...]
articles.title: CELTIC RIVAL BAN FEAR

The Celtic winger, who has figured for only 28 minutes in Brendan Rodgers’ first team since his £2million arrival [...]

articles.description: ‘IF I play more then you will see the lion. I will fight for the team, do anything for the team. I will go to war for the team and win for the team. articles.description: MY LONG-SUFFERING missus would most assuredly endorse the fact I have not been blessed with a superabundance of tolerance. articles.description: ADAM MONTGOMERY’S season-long loan deal to Fleetwood Town has been cut short. The 21-year-old left-back has returned to Celtic following an injury-stricken spell at the English third-tier club. Montgomery, who has also previous temporary spells at St Johnstone and Aberdeen, signed a 12-month contract in July last year to be reunited with Hoops legend Scott [...]

articles.description: FORMER Celtic goal hero Chris Sutton has highlighted the dilemma facing Brendan Rodgers in this month’s transfer market. The incoming Hoops boss urgently required firepower with Mark Viduka already [...]

Now Kwon, 22, who signed a five-year contract at the Hoops, has agreed a loan deal with St Mirren until the [...]

articles.description:
From the city centre to Janefield Street, Celtic fans have plenty of options available for a few pre and post-match drinks. The walk to Paradise offers plenty of choice for supporters to take in the atmosphere, whether you want to sing along with songs of love, hope and freedom or grab a bite to […]
The post A few wee Glasgow pub picks appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: A few wee Glasgow pub picks
